MemberSignature.Value: public float[] MapVector2 (float[] src2);
.method public hidebysig instance float32[] MapVector2(float32[] src2) cil managed

Docs.param: The array of [x, y] pairs. The array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2.
Docs.summary: Applies the matrix to a series of [x, y] pairs, returning the [x', y', z', w'] result.
Docs.returns: Returns the resulting [x', y', z', w'] sets.

remarks.para: The source array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2 (2, 4, 6, 8, ...). The resulting array will have an entry count of a multiple of 4 (4, 8, 12, 16, ...).
The source array has an implied z-value of 0 and a w-value of 1, equivalent to [x, y, 0, 1].

MemberSignature.Value: public void MapVector2 (float[] src2, float[] dst4);
.method public hidebysig instance void MapVector2(float32[] src2, float32[] dst4) cil managed

Docs.param: The array of [x, y] pairs. The array must have an entry count of a multiple of 2.
Returns the resulting [x', y', z', w'] sets. The array must have an entry count of a multiple of 4, and the same number of vectors as the source has pairs.
Docs.summary: Applies the matrix to a series of [x, y] pairs, returning the [x', y', z', w'] result.
Docs.remarks: The source array has an implied z-value of 0 and a w-value of 1, equivalent to [x, y, 0, 1].

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Preserves2DAxisAlignment (float epsilon);
.method public hidebysig instance bool Preserves2DAxisAlignment(float32 epsilon) cil managed

Docs.param: The amount of error to allow for when determining axis-alignment.
Docs.summary: Determines if transforming an axis-aligned square in 2D by this matrix will produce another 2D, axis-aligned square.
Docs.returns: Returns if the matrix preserves 2D axis alignment, otherwise .
Docs.remarks: If the result is , it typically means the matrix is a scale with perhaps a 90-degree rotation. A 3D rotation through 90 degrees into a perpendicular plane collapses a square to a line, but is still considered to be axis-aligned.
